contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox football biography | name = Quinton Young | image= | fullname = Quinton Young | height = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=y|1947|9|19}} | birth_place = [[Irvine, North Ayrshire|Irvine]], [[Scotland]] | position = [[Midfielder|Left winger]] | years1 = 1969-1971 | years2 = 1971-1973 | years3 = 1973-1976 | years4 = 1976-1980 | clubs1 = [[Ayr United F.C.|Ayr United]] | clubs2 = [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] | clubs3 = [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] | clubs4 = [[East Fife F.C.|East Fife]] | caps1 = 67 | goals1 = 9 | caps2 = 26 | goals2 = 2 | caps3 = 82 | goals3 = 28 | caps4 = 67 | goals4 = 9 | totalcaps = 242 | totalgoals= 48 | nationalyears1 = 1971 | nationalteam1 = [[Scotland national under-23 football team|Scotland U23]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 }} '''Quinton Young''' (born 19 September 1947 in [[Irvine, North Ayrshire|Irvine]]) is a former [[Scotland|Scottish]] football player. He is best known for his time with [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]]. Young started his career at local side [[Ayr United F.C.|Ayr United]] in 1969 before moving to [[England|English]] team [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] two years later.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.neilbrown.newcastlefans.com/player/quintinyoung.htm |title=Quinton Young |publisher=Neil Brown Newcastle Fans|accessdate=17 March 2010}}</ref> After two season in [[England]] he moved to [[Ibrox, Glasgow|Ibrox]]. He spent three seasons at [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] and played both legs of the first ever [[European Super Cup]] against [[Ajax Amsterdam]]. He scored for [[Rangers F.C|Rangers]] in the second leg in [[Amsterdam]] albeit Rangers still lost the match 3-2 and the tie 6-3 on aggregate. Young left [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] acrimoniously after a fall out with then manager [[Jock Wallace, Jr.|Jock Wallace]]. After requesting a meeting with Wallace because he was unhappy about not being in the first team, an argument ensued and Young was given a free transfer. He subsequently joined [[East Fife F.C.|East Fife]] in 1976.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/football/2008/11/03/when-bobby-was-a-bhoy-86908-20865125/ |title=When Bobby Was A Bhoy |publisher=Daily Record|date=3 November 2008}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist|1}} ==External links== *[http://www.gersnetonline.co.uk/archived/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=68&Itemid=31 Details of Rangers career] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Young, Quinton | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Scottish footballer | DATE OF BIRTH =19 September 1947 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Irvine, North Ayrshire|Irvine]], [[Scotland]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Young, Quinton}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Ayr United F.C. players]] [[Category:Coventry City F.C. players]] [[Category:Rangers F.C. players]] [[Category:East Fife F.C. players]] [[Category:Scottish Football League players]] [[Category:The Football League players]] [[Category:Scottish footballers]] [[Category:Association football wingers]] [[Category:Scotland under-23 international footballers]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Irvine, North Ayrshire]]
